019package org.jgrapes.util.events;
020
021import java.util.Collection;
022import java.util.Collections;
023import java.util.HashMap;
024import java.util.HashSet;
025import java.util.Map;
026import java.util.Optional;
027import java.util.Set;
028import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
029import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
030import org.jgrapes.util.ConfigurationStore;
031
032/**
033 * An event to indicate that configuration information has been
034 * updated.
035 * 
036 * Configuration information provided by this event is organized
037 * by paths and provided as key/value pairs. The path information
038 * should be used by components to select the information important
039 * to them. Often, a component simply matches the path from the event
040 * with its own path in the component hierarchy 
041 * (see {@link Manager#componentPath()}). But paths can also be used
042 * to structure information in a way that is completely independent of
043 * the implementation's structure as the filtering is completely up
044 * to the component.
045 * 
046 * Configuration information should be kept simple. Sometimes, however,
047 * it is unavoidable to structure the information associated
048 * with a (logical) key. This should be done by reflecting the structure
049 * in the names of the keys. Names "key.0", "key.1", "key.2"
050 * can be used to express that the value associated with "key" is 
051 * actually a list of values. "key.a", "key.b", "key.c" can be used
052 * to associate "key" with a map from "a", "b", "c" to some values.
053 * To support this kind of structuring by keys, the method 
054 * {@link #set(String, Map)} can be used to associate a path with
055 * structured information, consisting of (nested) {@link Map}s and 
056 * {@link Collection}s. The leaf nodes in this structures are used
057 * as values after applying {@link Object#toString()} to them.
058 * Method {@link #structured(String)} can be used to retrieve information
059 * as structured value, no matter if the information was initially provided
060 * by {@link #set(String, Map)} or by several invocations of
061 * {@link #add(String, String, String)}.
062 * 
063 */
064@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
065public class ConfigurationUpdate extends Event<Void> {
066
067    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap",
068        "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
069    private final Map<String, Map<String, String>> flatValues = new HashMap<>();
070    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
071    private final Map<String, Map<String, ?>> structuredValues
072        = new HashMap<>();
073
074    /**
075     * Set new (updated) structured configuration values for the event.
076     * Any information associated with the path before the invocation
077     * of this method is replaced.  
078     * 
079     * @param path the value's path
080     * @return the event for easy chaining
081     */
082    public ConfigurationUpdate set(String path, Map<String, ?> values) {
083        if (path == null || !path.startsWith("/")) {
084            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Path must start with \"/\".");
085        }
086        synchronized (this) {
087            flatValues.remove(path);
088            structuredValues.put(path, values);
089        }
090        return this;
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Return the structured properties for a given path if they exists.
095     * 
096     * @param path the path
097     * @return the updated values or `null` if the path has been
098     * removed (implies the removal of all values for that path).
099     */
100    public Optional<Map<String, ?>> structured(String path) {
101        synchronized (this) {
102            Map<String, ?> result;
103            if (!structuredValues.containsKey(path)
104                && flatValues.containsKey(path)) {
105                // Synchronize to structured and return
106                result = ConfigurationStore.structure(flatValues.get(path));
107                structuredValues.put(path, result);
108            } else {
109                result = structuredValues.get(path);
110            }
111            if (result == null) {
112                return Optional.empty();
113            }
114            return Optional.of(Collections.unmodifiableMap(result));
115        }
116    }
117
118    /**
119     * Add a new (or updated) configuration value to the event.
120     * 
121     * @param path the value's path
122     * @param key the key of the value
123     * @param value the value
124     * @return the event for easy chaining
125     */
126    public ConfigurationUpdate add(String path, String key, String value) {
127        if (path == null || !path.startsWith("/")) {
128            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Path must start with \"/\".");
129        }
130        synchronized (this) {
131            if (!flatValues.containsKey(path)
132                && structuredValues.containsKey(path)) {
133                // Flattened version becomes current, invalidate structured
134                flatValues.put(path,
135                    ConfigurationStore.flatten(structuredValues.get(path)));
136            }
137            structuredValues.remove(path);
138            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
139            Map<String, String> scoped = flatValues
140                .computeIfAbsent(path, newKey -> new HashMap<String, String>());
141            scoped.put(key, value);
142        }
143        return this;
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * Signal to handlers that a path has been removed from the 
148     * configuration.
149     * 
150     * @param path the path that has been removed
151     * @return the event for easy chaining
152     */
153    public ConfigurationUpdate removePath(String path) {
154        if (path == null || !path.startsWith("/")) {
155            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Path must start with \"/\".");
156        }
157        synchronized (this) {
158            flatValues.put(path, null);
159            structuredValues.remove(path);
160        }
161        return this;
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * Return all paths affected by this event.
166     * 
167     * @return the paths
168     */
169    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ConfusingTernary")
170    public Set<String> paths() {
171        synchronized (this) {
172            Set<String> result = new HashSet<>(flatValues.keySet());
173            result.addAll(structuredValues.keySet());
174            return result;
175        }
176    }
177
178    /**
179     * Return the properties for a given path if they exists.
180     * 
181     * @param path the path
182     * @return the updated values or `null` if the path has been
183     * removed (implies the removal of all values for that path).
184     */
185    public Optional<Map<String, String>> values(String path) {
186        synchronized (this) {
187            Map<String, String> result;
188            if (!flatValues.containsKey(path)
189                && structuredValues.containsKey(path)) {
190                // Synchronize to flatValues and return
191                result = ConfigurationStore.flatten(structuredValues.get(path));
192                flatValues.put(path, result);
193            } else {
194                result = flatValues.get(path);
195            }
196            if (result == null) {
197                return Optional.empty();
198            }
199            return Optional.of(Collections.unmodifiableMap(result));
200        }
201    }
202
203    /**
204     * Return the value with the given path and key if it exists.
205     * 
206     * @param path the path
207     * @param key the key
208     * @return the value
209     */
210    public Optional<String> value(String path, String key) {
211        if (!flatValues.containsKey(path)
212            && structuredValues.containsKey(path)) {
213            flatValues.put(path,
214                ConfigurationStore.flatten(structuredValues.get(path)));
215        }
216        return Optional.ofNullable(flatValues.get(path))
217            .flatMap(map -> Optional.ofNullable(map.get(key)));
218    }
219}
